page.title: 04CARVINGS IN THURSTON CHURCH
page.content:
WOODCARVINGS IN THE PARISH CHURCH
The church has lots of carvings:there are carvings of Saints,including St.Peter with his keys.Another has a staff and a water bottle. There is a Font which was made in the 14th Century;it has a carved lid. There is a carving of a Pelican;the Pelican is supposed to peck its own breast and feed its young with its own blood. There is a carving with two heads and four arms. Lots of little faces are hidden in the pews. I think the carvings are there to help people understand the Bible stories,and sometimes the carpenter was having a little joke.
